name: Grand Canyon
hint: A steep-sided gorge carved by the Colorado River in Arizona, one of the most iconic natural landmarks in the US

name: Great Plains
hint: A vast expanse of flat grassland stretching from Canada to Texas in central North America

name: Rocky Mountains
hint: A major mountain range stretching over 4,800 km from British Columbia to New Mexico

name: Appalachian Mountains
hint: An ancient mountain system in eastern North America stretching from Alabama to Newfoundland

name: Death Valley
hint: The hottest place on Earth and the lowest point in North America, in the Mojave Desert of California

name: Everglades
hint: A tropical wetland ecosystem in southern Florida, known as the River of Grass

name: Great Basin
hint: A large endorheic watershed in the western US where rivers do not drain to the ocean, mostly in Nevada

name: Canadian Shield
hint: A large area of exposed Precambrian rock forming the geological core of North America, covering much of central Canada
